subject: Philosophy
title: Machiavelli's Realism
description: A quick, practical guide to Machiavelli's Realism.

hook.text: Machiavelli told princes: it's better to be feared than loved. And he meant it.

buildup.text: The Prince shocked Renaissance Italy by arguing that morality and politics are separate games.

discovery.text: A good ruler must sometimes lie, deceive, and use force. Idealism gets you overthrown.

twist.text: Was he advising tyrants â€” or exposing how power really works so citizens could protect themselves?

climax.text: Machiavelli invented political realism. His ideas shaped diplomacy, war strategy, and modern statecraft.

punchline.text: Politics isn't about ideals. It's about what actually works.

quiz.question: What was Machiavelli's key insight?
options: Effective governance sometimes requires moral compromise
Democracy is the only good system
